quest.name: Meet the Tholls
journal: Tristol knows people who may be able to assist in your search for ore.

Tristol informs you that a dwarven family known as the Tholls have long mined this land, and none know its bounty as well as they. If you explain to them your situation, the painter is confident that they would be willing to cooperate in your search for ore. Thus do you and the Exarch set out for the village of Tomra to seek an audience with its chief, a dwarf named Xamott.

At the entrance to Tomra, you and the Exarch are greeted by a boisterous dwarf. Having traded lali-hos to his satisfaction, he reveals himself to be none other than Xamott. While he is keen to assist any endeavor that will restore peace to their home, he will only help you find the ore if he is certain you will put it to good use. To that end, he requires that you undertake a trial most tricksy, and invites you into the village to learn more.

Xamott informs you that, when dwarves of his village come of age, each of them must prove their readiness to take to the mines. This they do by undertaking a traditional trial─the curiously named 3-D MineRunner. In this trial, you are given a slingshot, which you must use to shoot the dwarf who wears a different helm from that of the Tholls. When you are ready to begin, you are to report to the observer nearby.
The dwarf observer takes you to the rooftops, where you have a practice run of the trial. The next time will be the actual trial, where failure is a possibility.

With your combination of discernment, diligence, and dexterity, you succeed in passing the dwarves' trial. The observer instructs you to return to Xamott, that you might get on with the business of putting an end to the strangeness that racks the land.
Impressed with your showing in the trial, Xamott declares that he will place his faith in you and help you to find the ore you seek for the Talos heart.
objectives: Speak with the dwarf observer and undertake the trial.
Speak with the dwarf observer again and undertake the true trial.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: A quest for the Talos's heart... This presents an unexpected opportunity.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: Ideally, a Talos heart should be made from ore found in the selfsame region as the stone for the chassis. Let's see what Tristol can tell us.

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: I'm glad Tristol was willing to lend us an ear. It's but a small step, but I pray this will pave the way for reconciliation.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: If you seek material for the Talos's heart, I know people who may be able to assist.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: They are the Tholls, a dwarven family that have long mined this land. No one knows its bounty as well as they.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: If you explain your situation, I'm sure they would be willing to cooperate. Indeed, 'twas one of them that showed me the secret tunnel to the top of the cliff.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: You will find the Tholls at their village to the northwest, a place called Tomra. When you arrive, seek an audience with Chief Xamott...and do not forget to greet him with a hearty lali-ho!

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Permit me to join you, Forename. I would keep my joints limber, and mayhap I can provide some manner of assistance.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I'll leave the heart to the two of you, then. The variety of ore doesn't matter so long as it's rich with aether.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: I'll aim to have my design complete by your return.

dialogue.name: CHAINUZZ
dialogue.text: If aether-rich ore proves elusive, we can make up for it with quantity. The Stoneworks had techniques for such situations.

dialogue.name: DULIACHAI
dialogue.text: Is the Exarch unwell? Do take care out there.

dialogue.name: TRISTOL
dialogue.text: After the Ladder stopped moving, the Tholls used secret tunnels to move freely around the island. While they mostly keep to themselves, they are a friendly folk.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: So this is Tomra...

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Seldom do we see the dwarven folk at the Crystarium. To now be in the presence of so many...

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: I shall enjoy not having to crane my neck for a change.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Dwarf-)Lali-ho!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Lali-ho!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Lali...ho?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: What did you just call me!?

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Dwarf-)Ah, a rousin' greeting! You've clearly been practicin'!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Dwarf-)What sorry excuse for a greeting was that!? Where's your heart, lasslad!? Your stones!?

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Dwarf-)It's a greeting, lasslad! A lali-ho for a lali-ho─that's the way it works!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Dwarf-)Come, let's try it again!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Dwarf-)Lali-hoooooo!

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: Lali-hoooooo!

dialogue.name: A2
dialogue.text: L-Lali-ho!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Dwarf-)Hmmm, not bad, not bad. But there's room for improvement.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Dwarf-)Anyroad, now that we've observed common courtesy─who are you and what're you doin' here?

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: (-Boisterous Dwarf-)Anyroad, now that we've observed common courtesy─who are you and what happened to your helm?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: At the recommendation of the denizens of Amity, we have come to seek the aid of the Tholl family. May we speak with Chief Xamott?

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Why, yes you may! I am Xamott, and I bid you welcome to Tomra!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: If it's the folk of Amity what sent you here, you must have quite a tale to tell. Come, let's hear it!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Well, well! And there I thought those below had no fight left in 'em!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Havin' said that, it's not like we know how to deal with that floatin' volcano and all them sin eaters neither.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: If you're serious about restorin' peace to these parts, though, we'll gladly lend you a hand.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: However!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: The kind of ore you seek's precious to us too.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: If I let you have it only for you to bungle things up and squander it, like, no amount of ale will wash away my chagrin.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: First, I need to make sure you're worthy─by means of a trial! Aye, a trial most tricksy, passed down through the line of Tholl!

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: And what is this trial?

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Heh heh heh... Come with me and I'll tell you all.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: What could this trial be...?

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Heh heh heh... Listen well.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: As you know, we're a minin' folk. And in the minin' life, danger's a constant companion.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: So, when we come of age, each of us must prove our readiness to take to the mines.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: This we do by undertakin' a trial what tests the three traits all good miners can't do without: discernment, diligence, and dexterity. We call it...3-D MineRunner!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Now, look on my helm. Mark its features well. You'll be given a slingshot, which you must use to shoot dwarves as wear helms what are different.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: I've already made the necessary arrangements. When you're ready to take the trial, report to the observer nearby. Best of luck to you!

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Well, I am pleased that the trial isn't needlessly dangerous. Though the dwarves who are our targets may beg to differ.

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Would you care to do the honors, my friend? It scarce needs to be said, but you are best suited of the two of us.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Aye, take a good look at my helm. The pair of magnificent horns. It's the mark of our clan, and if you see it─for goodness' sake, stay your hand!

dialogue.name: GUIDEDWARF03637
dialogue.text: Lali-ho! You must be the challenger the chief mentioned. I'll show you to the rooftop at once.

dialogue.name: GUIDEDWARF03637
dialogue.text: As I'm sure you've been told, in 3-D MineRunner, you use a slingshot to shoot them as wear the wrong helm. Let's begin with a spot of practice, eh?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Search for the dwarf wearing the wrong type of helm. You may move the camera, as well as zoom in and out. Target the dwarf and use the slingshot with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: GUIDEDWARF03637
dialogue.text: Aye, that's the way!

dialogue.name: GUIDEDWARF03637
dialogue.text: Next time, it's the trial for true. Let me know when you're ready, eh?

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: I shall pray for your success.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Good form there, lasslad, but that was only practice. The actual trial's a deal harder!

dialogue.name: GUIDEDWARF03637
dialogue.text: Ready for the trial? Right this way, then!

dialogue.name: GUIDEDWARF03637
dialogue.text: This time, there'll be them as wear the right helm. You shoot them, you fail, so look carefully afore you let the stone fly!

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Search for the dwarf wearing the wrong type of helm. You may move the camera, as well as zoom in and out. Target the dwarf and use the slingshot with [???] / [???].

dialogue.name: GUIDEDWARF03637
dialogue.text: Well done, well done! The trial never lies─you've got what it takes to be a miner!

dialogue.name: GUIDEDWARF03637
dialogue.text: Run along back to the chief, now, and get on with puttin' an end to all this strangeness of late!

dialogue.name: MYSTERYVOICE
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Though such a trial must be as a relaxing diversion compared to your usual endeavors, it was still an impressive display.

dialogue.name: GUIDEDWARF03637
dialogue.text: Oh, no need to worry about them as you struck. They wouldn't have felt it through their armor.

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: That was some impressive shooting, lasslad! Consider me satisfied!

dialogue.name: XAMOTT
dialogue.text: Aye, 'tis plain you didn't come this far with luck alone. So I'll place my faith in you, and help you find the ore you seek.
